Award.AwardTitle: Planning IUCRC at Louisiana Tech University: Center for Innovations in Structural Integrity Assurance (CISIA)
Award.AbstractNarration:
Louisiana State University (LSU) and Louisiana Tech University (LA Tech) propose to establish the Center for Innovations in Structural Integrity Assurance (CISIA). Structural integrity and reliable life prediction of infrastructure and mechanical components have relevance in every public and private sector, ranging from oil & gas to aerospace to construction to energy processing industries. In addition to fundamental research for establishing linkages between material properties, infrastructure performance, and structural integrity ?which is beyond the scope of most industrial R&D organizations of today? the academic and industrial members of CISIA will work in concert to produce engineers who are trained in state-of-the-art facilities to utilize modern methods of structural health monitoring and analysis. These engineers will join a highly-qualified and productive workforce that significantly enhances the global competitiveness of U.S. industries.

The LA Tech site of CISIA focuses on structural integrity of structural systems, with emphasis on deteriorated material characterization/testing and innovative sensor development, to conduct research on pipe, structural member, and composite rehabilitation component performance, life-cycle assessment, non-destructive condition determination, and failure prediction. By integrating validated diagnostics, machine learning, and data-driven decision making, CISIA will be well-positioned to interpret and translate the links between structural material design, operational performance, structural repair, and their collective impact on reliability across all U.S. industrial sectors.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The purpose of this project was to support the planning, development, and execution of an Industry/University Collaborative Research Center (IUCRC) planning workshop for the Center for Innovations in Structural Integrity Assurance (CISIA). A major goal was to assess the level of interest in such an IUCRC and to collect input on the technical directions of most interest to the potential participating industry members.

In this project, Louisiana Tech University and LSU strategically planned the center aspects such as center organization, leadership, funding management, and technical focus. Center leaders attended a Bootcamp organized by NSF in D.C., which was very beneficial to organizing the industry interviews. Afterwards the center team conducted dozens of interviews with organizations in the sectors of energy, critical infrastructure, petro chemical and chemical, maritime and marine, and associated service providers to those sectors to discover their needs for such an IUCRC center and determine the center value propositions. The planning workshop meeting was held in August 2019 at Baton Rouge, LA, and was attended by over 15 representatives of potential IUCRC member organizations. The meeting was comprised of an overview of CISIA, NSF presentation on the IUCRC program, presentations of 10 potential projects, and an industry-led discussion on areas of research interest and need.

Key outcomes are as follows (1) The Center has obtained viable interest from potential members to warrant a Phase 1 center. They represent stakeholders in the sectors of energy, critical infrastructure, petro chemical and chemical, and associated service providers. (2) The Center received varying degrees of support for nearly all of the projects presented at the workshop, and discussions about these presentations led to refinement in the scope by project leaders. The industry-led discussions also identified other research directions of interest that had not been represented by the 10 presentations. Integrating all the industry feedback, the team has identified an initial set of research areas that are of strong interest to the industry, and plans to explore these areas. (3) The Center has defined its Value Proposition that covers a wide range of values to industry members such as student hiring, networking opportunities, and low-risk research discovery possibilities. (4) The Center has defined its leadership structure and management strategies for the successful initiation and growth of an IUCRC.
